stories.title: Graceful rate limit handling with circuit breakers

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a scraper receives a rate limit response (HTTP 429), when the rate limit is detected, then the circuit breaker transitions to 'open' state for that platform

Given a circuit breaker has been 'open' for the configured timeout period, when the timeout expires, then the circuit breaker transitions to 'half-open' state
Given a circuit breaker is in 'half-open' state, when a test request succeeds, then the circuit breaker transitions to 'closed' state and normal operation resumes
Given a circuit breaker is in 'half-open' state, when a test request fails, then the circuit breaker returns to 'open' state and the timeout period resets

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a scraping request fails with a retryable error (network timeout, 5xx response), when the first retry is attempted, then the system waits for the base delay period (e.g., 1 second)
Given a retry fails, when subsequent retries are attempted, then the delay period doubles with each attempt (1s, 2s, 4s, 8s, etc.)
Given multiple retry attempts, when the maximum number of retries is reached (e.g., 5 attempts), then the scraping job fails and logs the final error
Given exponential backoff is in progress, when a maximum delay threshold is reached (e.g., 60 seconds), then subsequent retries use the maximum delay instead of continuing to double
Given a non-retryable error occurs (4xx client errors except 429), when the error is detected, then no retries are attempted and the job fails immediately

stories.iWant: the system to automatically identify technical skills from uploaded CVs
stories.soThat: I can quickly assess candidate capabilities

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a CV contains programming languages (e.g., Python, JavaScript, Java), when skills extraction is performed, then these languages should be identified and categorized as technical skills
Given a CV contains frameworks and libraries (e.g., React, Django, Spring), when skills extraction is performed, then these should be identified and categorized appropriately
Given a CV contains tools and platforms (e.g., AWS, Docker, Git), when skills extraction is performed, then these should be identified and extracted
Given a CV contains database technologies (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB), when skills extraction is performed, then these should be identified and categorized
Given extracted technical skills, when the parsing is complete, then skills should be normalized to standard names and versions where applicable

stories.title: Extract work experience duration and details
stories.description: As a hiring manager, I want the system to extract work experience duration and job details from CVs so that I can evaluate candidate experience levels.
stories.iWant: the system to extract work experience duration and job details from CVs
stories.soThat: I can evaluate candidate experience levels

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a CV contains job positions with start and end dates, when experience extraction is performed, then the duration of each position should be calculated accurately
Given a CV contains current employment marked as 'Present' or 'Current', when experience extraction is performed, then the duration should be calculated from start date to current date
Given a CV contains job titles and company names, when experience extraction is performed, then these should be identified and extracted for each position
Given a CV contains overlapping employment periods, when experience extraction is performed, then total experience should account for concurrent roles appropriately
Given extracted experience data, when parsing is complete, then total years of experience should be calculated and available

stories.title: Extract education information from CV
stories.description: As a recruiter, I want the system to extract education details from CVs so that I can verify candidate qualifications and educational background.
stories.iWant: the system to extract education details from CVs
stories.soThat: I can verify candidate qualifications and educational background

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a CV contains degree information, when education extraction is performed, then degree types (Bachelor's, Master's, PhD, etc.) should be identified and extracted
Given a CV contains field of study information, when education extraction is performed, then the subject areas should be identified and extracted
Given a CV contains institution names, when education extraction is performed, then university or school names should be identified and extracted
Given a CV contains graduation dates or study periods, when education extraction is performed, then these dates should be identified and extracted
Given a CV contains certifications or professional qualifications, when education extraction is performed, then these should be identified separately from formal degrees

stories.title: Handle CV parsing errors and edge cases
stories.description: As a job seeker, I want to receive clear feedback when my CV cannot be parsed properly so that I can understand and resolve any issues.
stories.iWant: to receive clear feedback when my CV cannot be parsed properly
stories.soThat: I can understand and resolve any issues

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a CV with poor scan quality or image-based text, when parsing fails to meet 95% accuracy, then a helpful error message should be displayed suggesting a better quality document
Given a CV with password protection, when parsing is attempted, then an error message should indicate that password-protected files are not supported
Given a CV with no extractable text content, when parsing is performed, then an appropriate error message should be displayed
Given parsing encounters a timeout or system error, when the error occurs, then the user should be notified and given the option to retry
Given a CV is successfully parsed but with low confidence in extracted data, when parsing is complete, then warnings should be displayed indicating which sections may need manual review

stories.title: Create initial user profile with job preferences
stories.description: Users can set up their initial job search profile including basic preferences for location, technology, salary, experience level, and remote work to enable personalized job matching.
stories.iWant: to create a comprehensive profile with my job search preferences
stories.soThat: I can receive personalized job recommendations that match my criteria

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a new user registration, when I access the profile setup page, then I see form fields for target countries, preferred technologies, salary expectations, experience level, and remote preference
Given valid profile data, when I submit the initial profile form, then my preferences are saved and I receive confirmation of successful profile creation
Given incomplete required fields, when I attempt to save my profile, then I see validation errors highlighting missing information
Given a completed profile, when I navigate away and return, then my previously entered preferences are persisted and displayed

stories.title: Configure target countries for job search
stories.description: Users can specify one or multiple countries where they want to search for job opportunities, with support for common job markets and validation of country selections.
stories.iWant: to select specific countries where I want to find job opportunities
stories.soThat: I only see job listings from locations where I'm willing to work

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given the country selection field, when I view available options, then I see a searchable list of countries with common job markets prominently displayed
Given the country selection interface, when I select multiple countries, then all selected countries are displayed and can be individually removed
Given an invalid or unsupported country selection, when I attempt to save, then I receive an error message with supported alternatives
Given saved country preferences, when the job matching algorithm runs, then only jobs from selected countries are included in recommendations

stories.title: Set preferred technologies and skills
stories.description: Users can specify their preferred programming languages, frameworks, tools, and technical skills to match with relevant job opportunities that align with their expertise and interests.
stories.iWant: to specify my preferred technologies and technical skills
stories.soThat: I receive job recommendations that match my technical background and interests

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given the technology preferences section, when I start typing, then I see autocomplete suggestions for popular programming languages, frameworks, and tools
Given technology selection, when I add multiple technologies, then each technology is displayed as a removable tag with clear labels
Given technology preferences, when I save my profile, then the system validates that at least one technology is selected
Given saved technology preferences, when jobs are matched, then positions requiring or preferring my selected technologies are prioritized
Given custom technology input, when I enter a technology not in the predefined list, then it's accepted and saved as a custom preference

stories.title: Define salary expectations and currency preferences
stories.description: Users can set their minimum and maximum salary expectations with appropriate currency selection to ensure job recommendations align with their compensation requirements.
stories.iWant: to set my salary expectations with appropriate currency
stories.soThat: I only see job opportunities that meet my compensation requirements

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given the salary expectations form, when I view the fields, then I see separate inputs for minimum salary, maximum salary, and currency selection
Given salary input fields, when I enter non-numeric values, then I see validation errors prompting for valid numbers
Given minimum and maximum salary inputs, when minimum exceeds maximum, then I receive a validation error to correct the range
Given currency selection, when I choose a currency, then salary inputs automatically format according to that currency's conventions
Given saved salary preferences, when job matching occurs, then only positions within or above the specified salary range are recommended

stories.title: Specify experience level preferences
stories.description: Users can indicate their experience level (junior, mid-level, senior, lead) to receive job recommendations appropriate for their career stage and skill level.
stories.iWant: to specify my experience level
stories.soThat: I receive job recommendations appropriate for my career stage

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given the experience level selection, when I view options, then I see clearly defined levels: Junior (0-2 years), Mid-level (2-5 years), Senior (5-8 years), Lead (8+ years)
Given experience level options, when I select one level, then only that level is selected and others are deselected
Given no experience level selection, when I attempt to save my profile, then I receive a validation error requiring experience level selection
Given saved experience level, when job matching runs, then positions tagged for my experience level are prioritized in recommendations

stories.title: Configure remote work preferences
stories.description: Users can specify their remote work preferences including remote-only, hybrid, or on-site options to filter job opportunities based on work arrangement preferences.
stories.iWant: to specify my remote work preferences
stories.soThat: I only see job opportunities that match my preferred work arrangement

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given remote work preference options, when I view the selection, then I see choices for Remote Only, Hybrid, On-site, and No Preference
Given remote work selection, when I choose Remote Only, then the system hides location-dependent fields and focuses on timezone preferences
Given Hybrid selection, when I save preferences, then I can specify preferred days in office or remote work percentage
Given saved remote preferences, when job matching occurs, then only jobs matching my remote work requirements are included in recommendations

stories.title: Edit and update existing profile preferences
stories.description: Users can modify their previously saved job search preferences to adapt to changing career goals, skill development, or life circumstances.
stories.iWant: to update my existing profile preferences
stories.soThat: my job recommendations stay current with my evolving career goals

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given an existing profile, when I access the edit profile page, then all my current preferences are pre-populated in the form fields
Given profile editing, when I modify any preference and save, then only the changed fields are updated while others remain unchanged
Given unsaved changes, when I navigate away from the edit page, then I receive a confirmation prompt about losing unsaved changes
Given successful profile updates, when changes are saved, then I receive confirmation and my job recommendations are refreshed based on new preferences

stories.title: View and manage profile completeness
stories.description: Users can see their profile completion status and receive guidance on which preferences to add or improve for better job matching results.
stories.iWant: to see my profile completeness and get suggestions for improvement
stories.soThat: I can optimize my profile for better job matching results

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given profile access, when I view my profile dashboard, then I see a completion percentage based on filled required and optional fields
Given incomplete profile sections, when I view the profile, then I see specific suggestions for missing information that would improve matching
Given profile completion status, when completion is below 70%, then I see prominent prompts to complete missing sections
Given profile improvements, when I add missing information, then the completion percentage updates in real-time

stories.title: Calculate hybrid match score for job recommendations
stories.description: As a job seeker, I need the system to calculate accurate match scores between my profile and available jobs using a hybrid scoring algorithm that combines multiple matching approaches to provide the most relevant job recommendations.
stories.iWant: the system to calculate accurate match scores for jobs
stories.soThat: I receive the most relevant job recommendations based on comprehensive matching criteria

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a user profile and a job posting, when the match score is calculated, then the system returns a score between 0 and 100 percent

Given the hybrid scoring algorithm, when calculating a match score, then the final score is composed of exactly 30% TF-IDF similarity, 40% skill overlap, 20% experience match, and 10% semantic embeddings
Given multiple jobs for a user, when match scores are calculated, then each job receives an independent score calculation using the same hybrid algorithm
Given a user profile with missing information, when calculating match scores, then the system handles null or empty fields gracefully without failing the calculation
Given identical user profiles and job postings, when match scores are calculated multiple times, then the system returns consistent scores within 0.1% variance

stories.title: Calculate TF-IDF text similarity component
stories.description: As a job seeker, I need the system to analyze text similarity between my profile and job descriptions using TF-IDF to ensure keyword matching contributes appropriately to my match scores.
stories.iWant: TF-IDF text similarity to be calculated between my profile and job descriptions
stories.soThat: jobs with relevant keywords and terminology are properly weighted in my recommendations

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a user profile and job description, when TF-IDF similarity is calculated, then the component score is between 0 and 100 percent
Given the final match score calculation, when TF-IDF component is applied, then it contributes exactly 30% to the total hybrid score
Given text with common stop words, when calculating TF-IDF similarity, then stop words are properly filtered to improve matching accuracy
Given user profile text and job description with identical keywords, when TF-IDF similarity is calculated, then the component returns a high similarity score above 80%
Given user profile and job description with no common terms, when TF-IDF similarity is calculated, then the component returns a score near 0%

stories.title: Calculate skill overlap component
stories.description: As a job seeker, I need the system to analyze the overlap between my skills and job requirements to ensure skill matching has the highest weight in determining job compatibility.
stories.iWant: skill overlap between my profile and job requirements to be accurately calculated
stories.soThat: jobs requiring skills I possess are prioritized in my recommendations

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given user skills and job required skills, when skill overlap is calculated, then the component score is between 0 and 100 percent
Given the final match score calculation, when skill overlap component is applied, then it contributes exactly 40% to the total hybrid score
Given a user with all required skills for a job, when skill overlap is calculated, then the component returns 100% overlap
Given a user with partial skill matches, when skill overlap is calculated, then the score reflects the percentage of required skills possessed
Given skill variations in naming (e.g., 'JavaScript' vs 'JS'), when calculating skill overlap, then the system recognizes equivalent skills as matches
Given a user with no matching skills for a job, when skill overlap is calculated, then the component returns 0% overlap

stories.title: Calculate experience match component
stories.description: As a job seeker, I need the system to evaluate how well my experience level aligns with job requirements to ensure appropriate experience matching in job recommendations.
stories.iWant: my experience level to be matched against job experience requirements
stories.soThat: I receive job recommendations that align with my career level and experience

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given user experience and job experience requirements, when experience match is calculated, then the component score is between 0 and 100 percent
Given the final match score calculation, when experience match component is applied, then it contributes exactly 20% to the total hybrid score
Given user experience that exactly matches job requirements, when experience match is calculated, then the component returns 100% match
Given user experience that exceeds job requirements by 1-2 years, when experience match is calculated, then the component returns a high score above 90%
Given user experience significantly below job requirements, when experience match is calculated, then the component returns a proportionally lower score
Given user experience significantly above job requirements (overqualified), when experience match is calculated, then the component applies appropriate penalty to avoid mismatched recommendations

stories.title: Calculate semantic embeddings component
stories.description: As a job seeker, I need the system to use semantic embeddings to understand the deeper meaning and context of my profile and job descriptions beyond keyword matching.
stories.iWant: semantic embeddings to analyze the contextual meaning between my profile and job descriptions
stories.soThat: I receive recommendations that understand the semantic relationship between my background and job requirements

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given user profile and job description embeddings, when semantic similarity is calculated, then the component score is between 0 and 100 percent
Given the final match score calculation, when semantic embeddings component is applied, then it contributes exactly 10% to the total hybrid score
Given semantically similar profiles and job descriptions with different wording, when embeddings similarity is calculated, then the component detects semantic similarity above 70%
Given completely unrelated user profile and job description, when semantic embeddings are compared, then the component returns a low similarity score below 20%
Given text embeddings generation, when processing user profiles and job descriptions, then the system generates consistent vector representations for identical text inputs

stories.title: Validate hybrid scoring algorithm accuracy
stories.description: As a system administrator, I need to validate that the hybrid scoring algorithm produces mathematically correct and consistent results to ensure reliable job matching functionality.
stories.iWant: to validate the accuracy and consistency of the hybrid scoring algorithm
stories.soThat: users receive reliable and mathematically sound match scores for job recommendations

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given all four scoring components, when the hybrid score is calculated, then the weighted sum equals exactly 100% of the component contributions (30% + 40% + 20% + 10%)
Given edge case inputs (empty profiles, missing skills, zero experience), when hybrid scores are calculated, then the system handles all cases without errors and returns valid scores
Given the same user profile and job posting, when match scores are calculated across different system loads, then the scores remain consistent within 0.1% variance
Given performance requirements, when calculating match scores for 1000 user-job pairs, then the system completes calculations within 5 seconds
Given component score validation, when any individual component fails or returns invalid data, then the hybrid algorithm gracefully handles the error and continues with remaining components

stories.title: Analyze skill matches between CV and job posting
stories.description: As a job seeker, I want the system to identify which skills from my CV match the job requirements so that I can understand my alignment with the position.
stories.iWant: the system to identify which skills from my CV match the job requirements
stories.soThat: I can understand my alignment with the position

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a CV with skills ['Python', 'JavaScript', 'React'] and a job posting requiring ['Python', 'Java', 'React'], when skill analysis is performed, then matched skills should return ['Python', 'React']
Given a CV with skill 'Machine Learning' and a job posting requiring 'ML', when fuzzy matching is applied, then 'Machine Learning' should be identified as a match for 'ML'
Given a CV with skill 'JavaScript' and a job posting requiring 'JS', when fuzzy matching is applied, then 'JavaScript' should be identified as a match for 'JS'
Given a CV and job posting with no overlapping skills, when skill analysis is performed, then matched skills should return an empty array
Given skills that are case-insensitive variations like 'python' and 'Python', when skill matching is performed, then they should be identified as matches

stories.title: Identify missing skills for job requirements
stories.description: As a job seeker, I want the system to identify which job requirements I'm missing from my CV so that I can focus my skill development efforts on the most important gaps.
stories.iWant: the system to identify which job requirements I'm missing from my CV
stories.soThat: I can focus my skill development efforts on the most important gaps

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a CV with skills ['Python', 'React'] and a job posting requiring ['Python', 'Java', 'Docker', 'React'], when gap analysis is performed, then missing skills should return ['Java', 'Docker']
Given a CV with skill 'Frontend Development' and a job posting requiring 'UI Development', when fuzzy matching is applied, then 'UI Development' should not appear in missing skills
Given a CV that contains all job requirements, when gap analysis is performed, then missing skills should return an empty array
Given a job posting with synonymous skill requirements like 'Node.js' and 'NodeJS', and CV contains 'Node.js', when analysis is performed, then 'NodeJS' should not appear in missing skills
Given missing skills are identified, when results are returned, then skills should be prioritized by frequency of appearance in job posting text

stories.title: Identify extra skills beyond job requirements
stories.description: As a job seeker, I want the system to identify which skills I have that exceed the job requirements so that I can highlight my additional value proposition to employers.
stories.iWant: the system to identify which skills I have that exceed the job requirements
stories.soThat: I can highlight my additional value proposition to employers

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a CV with skills ['Python', 'Java', 'Docker', 'Kubernetes'] and a job posting requiring ['Python', 'Java'], when analysis is performed, then extra skills should return ['Docker', 'Kubernetes']
Given a CV with skill 'AWS' and a job posting requiring 'Amazon Web Services', when fuzzy matching is applied, then 'AWS' should not appear in extra skills
Given a CV with only skills that match job requirements, when analysis is performed, then extra skills should return an empty array
Given extra skills are identified, when results are returned, then skills should be categorized by relevance to the job domain

stories.title: Apply fuzzy matching for skill synonyms and variations
stories.description: As a job seeker, I want the system to recognize skill synonyms and variations so that my skill analysis is accurate even when different terminology is used.
stories.iWant: the system to recognize skill synonyms and variations
stories.soThat: my skill analysis is accurate even when different terminology is used

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given common synonyms like 'AI' and 'Artificial Intelligence', when fuzzy matching is applied, then they should be treated as equivalent skills
Given abbreviations like 'CSS' and full forms like 'Cascading Style Sheets', when matching is performed, then they should be recognized as the same skill
Given technology variations like 'React.js', 'ReactJS', and 'React', when fuzzy matching is applied, then they should be treated as equivalent
Given skills with minor spelling variations or typos within 80% similarity, when fuzzy matching is applied, then they should be considered potential matches
Given completely different skills like 'Python' and 'Java', when fuzzy matching is applied, then they should not be considered matches
Given version-specific skills like 'Python 3' and 'Python', when matching is performed, then they should be treated as equivalent for analysis purposes

stories.title: Generate comprehensive skill gap analysis report
stories.description: As a job seeker, I want to receive a comprehensive skill gap analysis report that combines matched, missing, and extra skills so that I have a complete understanding of my fit for the position.
stories.iWant: to receive a comprehensive skill gap analysis report that combines matched, missing, and extra skills
stories.soThat: I have a complete understanding of my fit for the position

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given skill analysis is completed, when generating the report, then it should include three distinct sections: matched skills, missing skills, and extra skills
Given the analysis report, when returned, then each skill should include confidence score for fuzzy matches above 80%
Given the skill gap analysis, when generating the report, then it should calculate and include an overall match percentage (matched skills / total job requirements)
Given missing skills are identified, when generating the report, then they should be ranked by importance based on frequency and context in job posting
Given the analysis is complete, when generating the report, then it should include metadata such as total skills analyzed, analysis timestamp, and fuzzy matching threshold used
Given skills that were matched through fuzzy logic, when included in the report, then they should be clearly marked with the original terms from both CV and job posting

stories.title: Generate AI-powered gap analysis report for job application
stories.description: As a job seeker, I need the system to generate a comprehensive gap analysis report using AI to understand my strengths, weaknesses, and improvement areas for a specific job application.
stories.iWant: to receive an AI-generated gap analysis report for my job application
stories.soThat: I can understand my strengths, missing skills, and get actionable improvement suggestions

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a job seeker has uploaded their resume and selected a job posting, when they request a gap analysis, then the system calls the local Ollama LLM service
Given the LLM analysis is complete, when the gap analysis report is generated, then it contains exactly 4 sections: strengths, missing skills, improvement suggestions, and overall assessment
Given the gap analysis report is generated, when displayed to the user, then the report loads within 30 seconds of the request
Given an error occurs during LLM processing, when the gap analysis fails, then the system displays a user-friendly error message and suggests retrying

stories.title: View identified strengths in gap analysis report
stories.description: As a job seeker, I want to see my identified strengths in the gap analysis report so that I can leverage them effectively in my job application and interviews.
stories.iWant: to view my identified strengths from the AI analysis
stories.soThat: I can highlight these strengths in my application and interview preparation

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given the gap analysis is complete, when viewing the strengths section, then it displays between 3 and 5 strength points
Given the strengths are displayed, when reviewing each strength, then each point is specific and directly related to the job requirements
Given the strengths section is populated, when viewing the content, then each strength includes supporting evidence from the resume or profile
Given no relevant strengths are found, when the analysis is complete, then the system displays a message indicating limited matching strengths and suggests profile enhancement

stories.title: View missing skills analysis in gap report
stories.description: As a job seeker, I want to see the missing skills identified by the AI analysis so that I can understand what capabilities I need to develop or acquire.
stories.iWant: to view the missing skills identified in the gap analysis
stories.soThat: I can understand what skills I need to develop to be more competitive for the role

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given the gap analysis is complete, when viewing the missing skills section, then it displays between 3 and 5 missing skill points
Given missing skills are identified, when reviewing each skill, then it is categorized by type (technical, soft skill, certification, experience)
Given missing skills are displayed, when viewing the content, then each skill includes the importance level (critical, important, nice-to-have) based on job requirements
Given the candidate profile closely matches job requirements, when no significant gaps exist, then the system displays a message indicating strong alignment with minimal gaps

stories.title: Receive actionable improvement suggestions
stories.description: As a job seeker, I want to receive specific, actionable improvement suggestions from the AI analysis so that I can take concrete steps to enhance my candidacy.
stories.iWant: to receive actionable improvement suggestions from the gap analysis
stories.soThat: I can take specific steps to improve my qualifications for the role

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given the gap analysis is complete, when viewing improvement suggestions, then it displays between 3 and 5 actionable items
Given improvement suggestions are generated, when reviewing each suggestion, then it includes specific actions (courses, certifications, projects, experience)
Given actionable suggestions are displayed, when viewing the content, then each suggestion includes an estimated timeframe for completion
Given improvement suggestions are provided, when reviewing the recommendations, then they are prioritized by impact on job match score

stories.title: View overall assessment summary
stories.description: As a job seeker, I want to see an overall assessment of my fit for the role so that I can understand my candidacy strength and make informed decisions about applying.
stories.iWant: to view an overall assessment of my job fit
stories.soThat: I can understand my overall candidacy strength and make informed application decisions

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given the gap analysis is complete, when viewing the overall assessment, then it provides a summary rating (strong match, good match, moderate match, weak match)
Given the overall assessment is displayed, when reviewing the summary, then it includes key factors that influenced the rating
Given the assessment summary is shown, when viewing the content, then it includes a confidence level for the AI analysis accuracy
Given the overall assessment is provided, when reviewing the summary, then it includes next steps recommendation (apply now, improve first, consider similar roles)

stories.title: Integrate LLM service for gap analysis processing
stories.description: As a system, I need to integrate with the local Ollama LLM service to process resume and job posting data for generating intelligent gap analysis reports.
stories.iWant: to integrate with Ollama LLM service for gap analysis processing
stories.soThat: I can generate intelligent, contextual gap analysis reports for job seekers

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a gap analysis request, when processing the data, then the system connects to the local Ollama LLM service endpoint
Given the LLM service connection, when sending analysis data, then the request includes structured resume data and job posting requirements
Given the LLM processes the request, when receiving the response, then the system validates the response contains all required sections (strengths, gaps, suggestions, assessment)
Given the Ollama service is unavailable, when attempting gap analysis, then the system handles the timeout gracefully and provides fallback messaging
Given malformed LLM responses, when processing the analysis, then the system validates response structure and requests regeneration if invalid

stories.title: Generate three cover letter variants with different styles
stories.description: As a job seeker, I want to generate three distinct cover letter variants (Conservative, Aggressive, Story-driven) so that I can choose the style that best matches the company culture and position I'm applying for.
stories.iWant: to generate three distinct cover letter variants with different styles
stories.soThat: I can choose the style that best matches the company culture and position I'm applying for

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a job posting and user profile, when I request cover letter generation, then the system generates exactly 3 variants labeled as Conservative, Aggressive, and Story-driven
Given cover letter generation is requested, when the process completes, then each variant is between 300-400 words in length
Given cover letter variants are generated, when I view them, then each variant has a distinct tone and approach appropriate to its style category
Given the generation process, when cover letters are created, then all variants use the local Ollama LLM service

stories.title: Generate Conservative style cover letter
stories.description: As a job seeker applying to traditional or corporate environments, I want to generate a Conservative style cover letter so that I can present myself in a professional and formal manner that aligns with conventional business expectations.
stories.asA: job seeker applying to traditional or corporate environments
stories.iWant: to generate a Conservative style cover letter
stories.soThat: I can present myself in a professional and formal manner that aligns with conventional business expectations

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a Conservative cover letter is generated, when I review the content, then it uses formal language, proper business letter structure, and professional tone throughout
Given a Conservative cover letter is generated, when I analyze the content, then it focuses on qualifications, experience, and skills in a straightforward manner without bold claims
Given a Conservative cover letter is generated, when I check the formatting, then it follows traditional business letter conventions with appropriate salutations and closings
Given a Conservative cover letter is generated, when I review the language, then it avoids superlatives, informal expressions, and overly casual phrasing

stories.title: Generate Aggressive style cover letter
stories.description: As a job seeker applying to competitive or dynamic environments, I want to generate an Aggressive style cover letter so that I can showcase my confidence, ambition, and strong value proposition to stand out from other candidates.
stories.asA: job seeker applying to competitive or dynamic environments
stories.iWant: to generate an Aggressive style cover letter
stories.soThat: I can showcase my confidence, ambition, and strong value proposition to stand out from other candidates

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given an Aggressive cover letter is generated, when I review the content, then it uses confident language, bold statements, and assertive tone throughout
Given an Aggressive cover letter is generated, when I analyze the content, then it emphasizes achievements with quantifiable results and strong action verbs
Given an Aggressive cover letter is generated, when I check the messaging, then it positions the candidate as a top performer who will drive results
Given an Aggressive cover letter is generated, when I review the language, then it includes power words, competitive terminology, and confident predictions of success

stories.title: Generate Story-driven style cover letter
stories.description: As a job seeker who wants to create personal connection, I want to generate a Story-driven style cover letter so that I can engage the reader through narrative elements that demonstrate my alignment with the role and company values.
stories.asA: job seeker who wants to create personal connection
stories.iWant: to generate a Story-driven style cover letter
stories.soThat: I can engage the reader through narrative elements that demonstrate my alignment with the role and company values

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a Story-driven cover letter is generated, when I review the content, then it includes narrative elements such as specific examples, anecdotes, or personal experiences
Given a Story-driven cover letter is generated, when I analyze the structure, then it follows a storytelling arc that connects personal experiences to job requirements
Given a Story-driven cover letter is generated, when I check the alignment, then it demonstrates clear connections between the candidate's story and the company's mission or values
Given a Story-driven cover letter is generated, when I review the tone, then it balances personal narrative with professional relevance and maintains engagement throughout

stories.title: Handle cover letter generation errors and edge cases
stories.description: As a job seeker, I want the system to handle errors gracefully during cover letter generation so that I receive helpful feedback when generation fails and can retry the process successfully.
stories.iWant: the system to handle errors gracefully during cover letter generation
stories.soThat: I receive helpful feedback when generation fails and can retry the process successfully

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given the Ollama LLM service is unavailable, when I request cover letter generation, then the system displays an appropriate error message and suggests retry options
Given insufficient input data is provided, when cover letter generation is attempted, then the system validates inputs and provides specific feedback on missing requirements
Given a cover letter variant fails to meet word count requirements, when generation completes, then the system either regenerates that variant or provides a clear error message
Given the generation process times out, when the timeout occurs, then the system provides a user-friendly error message and allows the user to retry

stories.title: Generate tailored CV with reordered bullet points
stories.description: As a job seeker, I want the system to analyze my CV against a job posting and reorder my experience bullet points by relevance, so that the most relevant achievements appear first for each role.
stories.iWant: the system to analyze my CV against a job posting and reorder my experience bullet points by relevance
stories.soThat: the most relevant achievements appear first for each role

acceptanceCriteria.description: Given a CV with multiple bullet points per role and a job posting, when I request CV tailoring, then bullet points are reordered with most relevant items first based on keyword matching and skill alignment
